title: Study of Pembrolizumab in Biomarker-positive Metastatic Non-small Cell Lung Cancer
description: A trial for patients with metastatic non-small cell lung cancer who test positive for specific biomarkers to evaluate the efficacy of pembrolizumab.

inclusion_criteria.text: Histologically or cytologically confirmed metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)
Positive for at least one of the following biomarkers: PD-L1 expression ≥1%, MSI-H, or TMB-high
Measurable disease according to RECIST 1.1 criteria

exclusion_criteria.text: EGFR mutation or ALK translocation positive
Prior treatment with any anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, or anti-CTLA-4 antibody
Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment within the past 2 years
Active or untreated CNS metastases

title: Osimertinib in EGFR-Mutated Non-small Cell Lung Cancer with Brain Metastases
description: A study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of osimertinib in patients with EGFR-mutated NSCLC with brain metastases.

inclusion_criteria.text: Histologically or cytologically confirmed locally advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer not amenable to curative surgery or radiotherapy
Documented EGFR exon 19 deletion or exon 21 L858R mutation

exclusion_criteria.text: T790M mutation positive
Prior treatment with EGFR-TKI therapy
Treatment with cytotoxic chemotherapy, investigational agents or other anticancer drugs within 2 weeks before the first dose of study treatment

title: Alectinib for ALK-Positive Advanced Lung Cancer
description: An open-label, single-arm study of alectinib in patients with ALK-positive advanced NSCLC who have previously received ALK-TKI therapy.

inclusion_criteria.text: Adults at least 18 years of age
Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of advanced or metastatic NSCLC that is ALK-positive as determined by an FDA-approved test
Prior treatment with at least one ALK TKI

exclusion_criteria.text: Prior treatment with alectinib
Symptomatic or unstable CNS metastases
Significant cardiovascular disease, including unstable angina, acute myocardial infarction within the previous 3 months, or congestive heart failure

title: Combination Therapy in Treatment-Naive Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
description: A randomized study of combination chemotherapy plus bevacizumab compared to FOLFOXIRI plus bevacizumab in patients with treatment-naive metastatic colorectal cancer.

inclusion_criteria.text: Histologically confirmed metastatic colorectal adenocarcinoma with at least one measurable lesion
Adequate hematologic, hepatic, and renal function

exclusion_criteria.text: Prior chemotherapy for metastatic disease
Active brain metastases
Uncontrolled hypertension
Major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to study treatment

title: Neoadjuvant Immunotherapy in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer
description: A study to evaluate the efficacy of neoadjuvant pembrolizumab combined with chemotherapy in early-stage triple-negative breast cancer.

inclusion_criteria.text: Histologically confirmed diagnosis of invasive triple-negative breast cancer (estrogen receptor negative, progesterone receptor negative, and HER2 negative)
Clinical stage II or III disease suitable for neoadjuvant therapy

exclusion_criteria.text: Metastatic disease (stage IV)
Prior chemotherapy, radiation therapy, or hormone therapy for the current breast cancer
Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment

title: KRAS G12C Inhibitor in Advanced Solid Tumors
description: A study of a KRAS G12C inhibitor in patients with advanced solid tumors harboring a KRAS G12C mutation.

inclusion_criteria.text: Locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor that has progressed on or after standard therapy
KRAS G12C mutation confirmed by a validated test

exclusion_criteria.text: Prior treatment with a KRAS G12C inhibitor
Symptomatic, untreated, or unstable CNS metastases
History of interstitial lung disease or pneumonitis requiring steroids

title: Immunotherapy for Elderly Patients with Advanced NSCLC
description: A study evaluating the safety and efficacy of pembrolizumab monotherapy in elderly patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer.

inclusion_criteria.text: Histologically or cytologically confirmed stage IV non-small cell lung cancer

exclusion_criteria.text: Sensitizing EGFR mutations or ALK translocations
Prior systemic treatment for metastatic NSCLC
Active autoimmune disease requiring systemic immunosuppression
Unstable or untreated brain metastases

title: Targeted Therapy for BRAF V600E Mutated Advanced Colorectal Cancer
description: A randomized study comparing standard chemotherapy versus encorafenib plus cetuximab in patients with BRAF V600E mutated metastatic colorectal cancer.

inclusion_criteria.text: Histologically or cytologically confirmed metastatic colorectal adenocarcinoma

exclusion_criteria.text: Prior treatment with RAF, MEK, or EGFR inhibitors
Known RAS mutation
Active CNS metastases

title: Antibody-Drug Conjugate in HER2-Positive Metastatic Breast Cancer
description: A study evaluating an antibody-drug conjugate in patients with HER2-positive metastatic breast cancer who have progressed on prior anti-HER2 therapies.

inclusion_criteria.text: Histologically confirmed, HER2-positive (IHC 3+ or ISH-positive) metastatic breast cancer
Prior treatment with trastuzumab and pertuzumab in any setting and T-DM1 in the metastatic setting

exclusion_criteria.text: History of unstable angina or myocardial infarction within 6 months
Left ventricular ejection fraction <50%
Symptomatic or progressive brain metastases

title: Experimental Drug for BRCA-Mutated Ovarian Cancer
description: A study of a novel PARP inhibitor in patients with BRCA-mutated platinum-sensitive recurrent ovarian cancer.

inclusion_criteria.text: Histologically confirmed recurrent epithelial ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal cancer
Deleterious or suspected deleterious BRCA1 or BRCA2 mutation (germline and/or somatic)
Received at least 2 prior lines of platinum-based chemotherapy and be platinum sensitive

exclusion_criteria.text: Prior treatment with any PARP inhibitor
History of myelodysplastic syndrome or acute myeloid leukemia
Inadequate bone marrow, renal, or hepatic function
